comment: I took this class about a year ago. It's not a hard class. I didn't personally enjoy it because it seemed like more of a communications class than a seminar class.

Prof Jones is nice and helps you prepare for college. Although sometimes you can enjoy the class, I would say that she takes the class a little too serious. You will have to do some work in the class, but it should not be a problem if you stay on top of it.

Professor Jones is one of my favorite professors. Her class is very eye opening and that the way that she teaches is unique. She works with students with whatever issues that they may have and is very understanding. The assignments are simple enough and presentations are fun. If you have speaking anxiety, schedule an appointment with her!
Very sweet and positive lady with so much energy! Pretty much an easy course but the final exam was on a Saturday night which was inconvenient and made no sense. Overall it was a fun class!

Petitte women with a HUGE heart. Professor Jones always brought positivity, energy, and compassion to each class. Thoroughly enjoyed attending lectures, visiting Maggie, and discussing thought-provoking issues. Beware: lots of busy work assigned. If you do the work, participate, and are creative in the group project you will get the A.

Most definitely one of the most caring professors I've endured. Great experience as a freshman requirement class. She's super upbeat and a bit quirky, but in a great way that's super relatable and enjoyable. She's got a HUGE heart and you won't regret taking her. Some things seem useless, but, it's an easy-A. Just participate here and there.

Easily the best and nicest professor I have ever met, you will not regret taking her. She does give a decent amount of work, but it is all very simple. There is one test and one quiz (both online) and they are both very simple. As long as you show up and do your work you will get an A.
Very fun and motivational. Easy to approach but assigns work with no clear instructions. She has encouraged me to do more and to be confident in myself, have to love her!

Professor Jones is amazing! She's super passionate abut teaching so her lectures are always energetic and awesome. I wasn't very excited about taking public speaking, but she definitely helped me improve my speaking skills. The only negative in this class was that she didn't give grades back very quickly. I would definitely take her again!!

Lots of work. I love this professor as a person, but this was my seminar class and was my hardest class out of 5 my first semester. She gives great lectures and really care about her students, but it was so much work that I felt like had nothing to do with preparing me for my first year. Got overwhelming at times, but it did help w/time management.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational

comment: The great thing about this class is that there were only two tests. However, she asks questions about stuff she never even taught in class. Seriously? And the questions were over inspirational quotes, not anything important. She grades heavily on if you raise your hand and smile at her. That's it. Unrealistic expectations completely.

Even though she is passionate about whatever she is teaching, she is incredibly scatterbrained and unorganized (which affects how she grades). She is not realistic whatsoever, and she scrutinizes introversion rather than appreciating how some people operate best 'behind the scenes'. She made this class stressful for everyone. Don't take her.
worst teacher. finished me with a c and doesnt grade easy at all!!!!!! DONT TAKE HER

Single-handedly one of the nicest professors I have ever met. She cares for her students more than any other professor I've known. As long as you show up and at least try, you're guaranteed a good grade. She looks for personal growth, so take the class seriously and you'll find a way to be a better person because of it.

Professor Jones really cares about helping her students succeed outside and inside the classroom. However,  there is a lot of work to do outside of class, and it is very time consuming. Since it's a required gen ed course, I feel there should have been less outside work to do, but if you do the work, it's a fairly easy A.

Professor Jones is easily in the top 3 best professors I have ever had. She is extremely passionate about what she does and brings a high level of good energy to every class. She genuinely cares about helping you personally succeed. Excellent choice.

I absolutely LOVE Prof Jones. Shes so sweet and so amazing and shes really funny! She wants you to be comfortable with yourself and shes more concerned about what you learn than anything. Shes not hard unless youre unwilling to do the work. 5 speeches, 1 Improv, not longer than 5-7 minutes. Rarely had any homework. I wish I didn't have to leave!

I didn't think I'd like public speaking, but Jones was amazing! I grew so much as a speaker during her class. She really cares about her students and encourages you to be the best you can be. She's very clear on what she expects, and wants you to participate. You really get to know your classmates through her in-class workshops. Take her class!

I absolutely loved Professor Jones! She made this class so comfortable, which is awesome because so many people have a fear of public speaking. She is very helpful when it comes to writing your speeches and grades very fairly. Just follow the rubric, and you're golden. I ended up loving this class! TAKE HER, you will not regret it.
Professor Jones was a ver careing professor. She wanted the best for you. The class is pretty straight forward. If you show up and do what she says it should be an easy A.

Professor Jones was absolutely great. Don't miss out on your opportunity to learn from her. She took so much time to prepare each student for success during their college career. She uses the rubric in a way to benefit the students and only teaches you what you want to learn. The only challenged I faced was with myself, due to her lectures.

Professor Jones  is here to help you. The class is all about developing you into who you want to be. She has masterminds to help all students share their struggles. No tests really. You have a few options fro final. Homework is just working on yourself.
She was great honestly. Super interested in every and all students. Class is about meeting people and she genuinely gives opportunities to do so.

Very tiny woman. Very kind hearted and wants you to truly succeed. Lot of love for students in that little body. Energetic, silly, and tries to get you to open up in a college environment. I hate FS but she makes it pretty bearable.
